I mean, we had been done for about 20 minutes before she even came up to us to check. Then another 10 minutes to check us out. There was a large birthday party there that night, so maybe they were taking up a lot of energy. I'll give them another chance next time I'm around the area.

2Fc3sdi4VneyJlBH3Ie3xw.review_text: Bruno's gets my vote of confidence as they are right next door to where we live in the Fillmore Center.  The food and service has been steadily getting better over the past couple of weeks, and I can see this place becoming a neighborhood favorite.  The pizza is decent, nothing special, but it gets the job done.    Personally, I like to go to brunos to have a beer and order a bunch of their appetizers.  Their garlic bread is awesome, as is the fresh mozzerella app.  Caesar salad and calamari is good as well.    Prices are competitive, plus you can't beat 20 minute delivery to our apartment!

-M0_X_LMxAyScHsLDTaDkw.review_text: Bruno's on Fillmore is our local pub.  Perhaps not every family with a one-year-old has a local pub, but we do, because they serve $2.75 beers every day, all day.  And good ones, too, like Dogfish Head 90-minute IPA and Rogue Dead Guy Ale and Racer 5 IPA.  But unlike pretty much every other place in the city with good deals on good beer, they love us and little B.  Actually, we ate here the night before B was born, while I was in labor.  It was our ninth anniversary, and we had canceled our dinner reservation at Boulevard that morning when I woke up with steady contractions.  After a full day of labor I could tell we weren't heading to the hospital any time soon, though, so after we took a long walk in the evening, we decided we might as well celebrate!  We walked to this new Italian place that had opened up a little while before, and enjoyed our first meal at Bruno's.  Then we went home and I did our taxes.  The next evening things finally got real, and at noon the next day Baby B was born.  Bruno's has highchairs and extremely friendly waitstaff.  The food is uneven--tonight we liked the ravioli but weren't wowed by the Chicken Fettuccine.  We frequently order the pizza, which is a good bargain, especially compared to Extreme up the street (the DC Mustang BBQ is our favorite).  They aren't breaking any new ground with the food; it's just a really nice place to spend a couple hours with friends, especially if you have a toddler in tow.  High chairs?  Yes. Changing tables?   Nope. Stroller-friendly?  Fairly.  We can always find a place to stow it. Noise level?  Low in the early evening when we go.  In the evenings it heats up due to those bargain beers. General baby-friendliness?  High.  Literally everyone at Bruno's loves our baby.

0LpOrrL-Rz1KIbFAgGBsKA.review_text: Checked this place out - since it happened to be next to my gym - hey why not right!  Strangely - I got the hankering to order a veggie pizza..which i never do  - well bad move on my part....  Issues. -I requested no olives on the pizza..pizza came with olives..so i sent it back..and 25 minutes later....out came my pizza...which was pretty mediocre..it probably would have been better with pepperoni :) -service was quite unattentive..took forever for the check..maybe it seemed like an eternity since i wanted t get out there.  Bottomline   Ill give this place another shot and see what happens..

rbofc9BEvXlm7RZG0o9eHQ.review_text: Stopped by for a quick dinner prior to a concert at the Fillmore on Saturday night.  My wife and I split a pizza - combo & Hawaiian combo.  Quality food & service.  Great stop - we'll be back with friends for the next show.

mwML1RyzBswYRi2i5TkTeg.review_text: There Hawaii 5-0 pizza is so so tasty.  The food is good and atmosphere is so warm and friendly.  I usually go right to the bar and order dinner there.  That way I can watch basketball and chat with Luca who is the attentive and funny bartender.  Every 20 minutes or so, Bruno comes by to make sure we are being taken care of.  This reminds me so much of  some of my neighborhood places in NYC.    My husband and I will come here or sometimes I just come by myself if I don't feel like cooking.  And the prices are not redic either.  Just a nice, down to earth neighborhood joint.  Looking forward to going back soon!

LSQsSMYUdxPs8VXFeYThyQ.review_text: Pretty cool spot. Food was on point. Nothing outrageously out of the norm, but I liked the way it looked inside. Friendly waiting staff. Decent portion size. Will come here again to try the calzone, and pizza probably. I had the lasagna which probably wasn't the best choice.

wbbAeHIv9651eYj9WiicbA.review_text: Very cozy, yet elegant pizzeria, with delicious appeteasers, large fresh salads, and divine pizza with great sauce and a thick, crisp crust.  OH, AND DID I MENTION THE INCREDIBLE BEER & ALE SELECTION???  To top it off, the owner (Michael) and his son (Sam) are warm and friendly, and make you feel right at home.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Do2W4nySb5D6Cpo1Tyb_hA.review_text: Walked in with a girlfriend Friday night at 7:45 and was seated at the bar in about 2 minutes. We lucked out in sitting next to a woman that worked for the architectural firm that designed the place, so we got a little history. The granite bar, dark red walls, darker red ceiling and lights make this a great date spot. It's also a perfect place to eat before an evening at Yoshi's. Besides the musical instruments on the walls, they also have large art pieces for sale. I do think $40,000 is a bit much for a painting with Charlie and Miles however.  We shared an Edge Iceberg Blue Cheese salad ($7.95). It had lovely dressing (and they brought us extra) large chunks of cheese, croutons, hearts of palm and sliced cherry tomatoes. I was practically licking the plate. Mz. Ann had a tagliatelle with ham, peas and an Alfredo sauce ($9.95). I thought the composition was lovely although the sauce could have been tastier. I had the chicken carcioffi with veggies ($12.95). The potatoes were exquisite - braised baby reds. The rest of the veggies were cauliflower, zucchini, broccoli etc that were steamed, a hair underdone, and somewhat lacking in flavor. Chicken breast was a little overcooked, but the sauce was lovely and complimented the artichokes well. We also had a bottle of Ruffino Chianti ($18.00) which is not a great wine, but for the price more than adequate. The waiter left the cork in the bottle after each pouring and I had to put it back, but that's a minor point. The waiters are some of the most drop-dead Italians I've seen in this city, and they pay attention to what you need. Overall, the price is very fair for the quality of the food, and not outrageous for the neighborhood. The wine list is a bargain.  I am definitely going back and look forward to adding a star when they get their groove on.

nLEmRPtgHoumkdvTfNHfTg.review_text: So, I returned.  I got the mozzarella sticks without the whatevertheycomewith.  They were delicious, very unexpected, but delicious.  A little pricey - $8.95 - for 8 mozzarella sticks.  Blah, okay.  The service was better than last time, but, their were no other customers in the place when I was there.  Again, the owner seems like he doesn't really care about customer service.  He was standing at the door when I left and I didn't get a "goodbye" or "thanks for coming".  The end always seals the deal for me.

Sz1ChS5E9bCYxaKwnb8Grg.review_text: I live directly upstairs from Brunos and have been in here to drink many times and to eat a few times now .. the only thing the Bruno's staff seems to be competent with is serving beer .. My most recent experience at Brunos was this past weekend when my roomate and I ordered a sandwich and a chickken pasta and were told it would take 15 minutes. After 30 minutes we went down to pick up our food and they seemed perplexed with our inquiry .. we then sat there for another 40 minutes while they made us 2 items? They gave us 2 beers on the house (which they are totally well qualified for) after this our food wasnt half bad. Service level here stinks, though the food isn't bad.

Mx8DbFUMDPl0sPD5y5HaKw.review_text: We stopped in tonight for dinner.  The salad was fresh, the pizza was hot and the wine was served chilled.  Best of all, the price was very reasonable.  Go for the pizza and enjoy the low prices.  Bruno, welcome back to the neighborhood...you.ve been missed!

IJABCqLsGgT8DxqujUQmiA.review_text: We stopped in today and enjoyed the outdoor seating! Great location and I'm thrilled they put the railing up around the cafe tables. The service was superb and a gentleman named Bruno came along and introduced himself to us and admired our puppy.   The pizza was excellent! We have searched and searched for that perfect pizza in SF and this was as close as we have ever found to being our ideal. Yum!   Very happy they joined the neighborhood!

dC5kYsLGGoLLVlMjeMqfLw.review_text: Bruno's has become a go to for my boyfriend and I. One...it's right around the corner from our apartment. And two...I have a healthy addiction to their steak salad. PIcture a bowl of goodness...full of greens, avocado, red onions, black beans, red peppers and tomatoes with delicious steak. So simple, but oh so good. Their garlic bread is legit...with and without cheese.   The bf has gotten the chicken parm, different calzones, chicken salad and a few other things...and has loved it all.   Besides loving their food...they also have a cute restaurant with a large bar. The staff is also very friendly and the service is super quick.   Overall...GET THE STEAK SALAD. Now! :)

lqKjYyeuFtcpbr2P1VeIpw.review_text: Good food and a really nice atmosphere. Friendly staff and a good selection of beer and wine.

_zT02V9ZbAN2JRCImL2IXw.review_text: It's relatively new so the atmosphere is chic and clean. After work, (I work nearby) my co-workers and I stopped by for a draft beer and pizza. The chicken, spinach and cheese (you can select) pizza was very good. I would go back again and will try other items soon. Price is moderate. I noticed the restaurant just added outside seating by the street. It's nice since it's right across from Yoshi's restaurant.

hxHKW9BU9H2D9wKxU440CQ.review_text: Awesome food, super-friendly staff. And the beer prices can't be beaten. Great selection of drafts, including the phenomenal Dogfish Head 90. I am happy to have Bruno's as my neighborhood hangout.

OFNFtTc48LmXNk_NeZe9dw.review_text: This place was really below expectations. The decor is lovely. The food (I only had the pizza) lacks flavor. I had to add balsamic vinegar, pepper and a dash of salt to make it taste better. It is the dough, it is flavorless.   Definitely not worth the money at all.   Service was really good. It is just the food is not up to par.

2loG39q-KBZ6f8ugGbyw7Q.review_text: As we waiting for a movie over at the Kabuki theater, we stumbled onto this place. It struck our eye when we saw "2.75 PINTS- ALL DAY EVERYDAY!" and below had icons of Dogfish Head and ROGUE! This is such a steal as Dogfish Head bottled beer sells for $14 a 4 pack in most liquor stores! Buying a pitcher was even cheaper at $8.95!  We grabbed a pizza too, which was delish, but the beer will keep us coming back!  Service was great, and nice atmosphere with full bar selections and Flat screen TVs.

K1NLdTfT1IizE-6smhsSug.review_text: First thought this place was f'n phenomenal with the $2.75 Dogfish Head 90 Minute IPA's, but that was until I saw they overcharged my credit card a couple of days later.   Walked in on Saturday during Filmore Jazz Festival and sat down to enjoy two DFH's. Paid my bill of $6.03 and gave her a $2.00 tip. Then see that they actually charged my cc...$14.06. Thanks for upping your tip $6.03. Service wasn't that damn good!   Even wrote them on their website to have this reversed, two days ago but am thinking they aren't really caring to respond.   Thanks a lot Bruno's!

rtmt6u29plpLwjkWNLtmXA.review_text: Courteous, fun staff. Great food. Nice beer selection (draft and bottles). Good sports games always on the TV screen. Chill, friendly atmosphere. Fast service.   What else could you want in a local restaurant catering to Western Addition locals?  A no brainer: four solid stars for Bruno's. My favorite neighborhood restaurant.

xKpNuBiO8QkjaBKceCvwNQ.review_text: What I like most about this place is the staff.... The owner Mike is very pleasant and professional. Its also nice walking into a place where they are on top of their cleanliness.  I think the food is great, and there is never much waiting time for the food to come out. I read on here people complaining about the service, and thats exactly what they are...COMPLAINERS.  The service is EXCELLENT. Its not easy doing what these guys do here, but they deserve all the credit in the world. I would recommend this place to anyone!

dTFhNxs-DJ1RwjVavT0XBw.review_text: This place is perfect for dinner and drinks before going to the Fillmore. All beers are $2.75, can't beat that as the same beer, but smaller will be $7.00 at the show.. The food was good, the service nice, the beers cheap and then you can walk to the Fillmore, can't go wrong.

Z7HCPOkQ7q8M8mbZTPUwZg.review_text: Sorry guys, but we can not go back there.  Saturday night we ordered take out Pizza.  We had been running around all day, so it's nice not having to cook and also check the new Pizza place nearby.  We ordered XL 1/2 & 1/2 (Sonoma and Club One)  When I went to pick it up, I was greeted by a friendly lady at the front.  And a gentleman went back to the kitchen and brought my pizza.  We went home and opened the box and we saw only chicken, tomatoes and cheese on the pizza. So we thought that they made a mistake and made only the Sonoma part of it.  We didn't bother to call that night, too much of a hassle.  I called today Sunday night to tell them what happened - I had noticed that there was another receipt that came with the pizza showing a smaller size (large) and a different pizza; I guess somebody got our pizza.  A person who answered the phone was so rude.  He told me that I had ordered the pizza yesterday and I got the pizza, so there's NOTHING he can do!!!  He didn't even want to hear my story. What a customer service they have!!  Especially this is a new restaurant and trying to make it in this tough economy.  I was very disappointed and sad.  I don't like to write negative comments on Yelp, but I can't help it this time.  We go to Yoshi's and other restaurants nearby, trying to support the local businesses. Bruno's looks nice and the the menu is very affordable but............   Hope this comment helps Bruno's think about better customer service in the future. They definitely need better training.   As for the Pizza, it was OK. If you like lots of cheese, that's your place. On the other hand I didn't get to taste the pizza which we had ordered, with more vegetable..  I'm going back to Escape From New York and get my Veggie Combo.   Bye, Ciao/

2RiznzrRsah3Iwv8YpiBPw.review_text: just ordered delivery from Bruno's, and I'm so pleased with them I just had to write it down right away.    so, I had just gotten home from work at 11:30pm, and I was SO hungry, but of course there's no food in my fridge.  I dig out the delivery menus, and notice that Bruno's has online ordering (one of my new favorite things) and that their delivery cut off is midnight.  awesome.  so, ten minutes later I have placed my order, and settle in to wait the hour or so it generally takes for a pizza to arrive. . .   but a mere 25 minutes later the delivery guy jolts me out of my internet reverie to hand me a delicious pizza and a gigantic salad!    so, while I'd like to apologize to Bruno's for ordering at the very end of the night, but I'm very happy that they got me my food so quickly!

SV4fFNO61JMTlxTxwESRKg.review_text: Holy Damn, this is the only reason i actually made a yelp, at first i thought it was just me but then i read other reviews and reolised they do this all the freaking time! DO NOT ORDER DELIVERY! I ordered using the eat24 app (Which is a really awesome app) and the ticket said 45-60minutes, so an hour and a half later i check in and they say that they sent someone, this store is down the street by the way, probably a 20minute walk from where i was, they say that the driver was here and trying to reach me. Now, im standing outside, on the corner, with no one and no car in sight, my phone hasn't rung once. He finally gets here over two hours after i ordered and tells me some bullshit story about how he was here, called, and no one answerd, so he left. He didnt call the pizza place, didnt refund my card, he just, left? My ass, the food was cold and i swear he must have just have forgoten about me. Read the other reivews, this happens all the damn time.

p-0-WnPB8mTV5b3E0saTGw.review_text: Pizzeria? More like Diarrhea.  They have DogFish Head for $2.75... NUFF SAID BRA!  "Why does my name sound like a nickname for someones pubic region?" Forest Whitaker

1D5EQITb4hOzPMZT8gDPQQ.review_text: Came here with the bf a couple of weekends ago because I'd gotten an online deal from $20 for $10. Thought I'd give the place a try.  We ordered a medium Club One Special - Roasted eggplant, portabello mushrooms, roasted red peppers, tomatoes, roasted garlic, bell peppers, olives  The pizza was good, but not great. Not memorable. We liked the idea of the variety of veggies, but the eggplant was a little bland and there just wasn't that special something in the pizza.  Other things on the menu sounded good, I'd be interested to branch out and try something else if there is a next time.

Z2PISdtGHThSUUbFccGkrA.review_text: Note: This review is based solely on their bar and happy hour.  I have not had any food from Bruno's and have yet to hear great things about it.  But I'm not writing about their food here, folks.  Hell, they could fire the chef and simply make this place a bar for all I care.  I'm here to tell you guys about a great deal that Bruno's manages to pull off: $2.75 pints of any of the many delicious draft beers they offer.  All day.  Every day.  A pint of 90 Minute IPA (which goes for $4 a bottle at most liquor stores)? $2.75.  How about a nice tall glass of Rasputin Stout or Rouge Dead Guy Ale? $2.75.  These bargains alone force me to give Bruno's 4 stars.  I also like how Bruno manages to hire semi-attractive, wild bartenders and waitress whom I've witnessed drinking on the job.  Awesome! I'll probably never eat here but will always consider stopping by here for a drink or two.

UKbUAZX45wnDillEWqb6mw.review_text: Pizza is good, wings are good, but seriously, if a restaurant doesn't know the difference between American Cheese and Cheddar Cheese I can't take them seriously.   Cheap beer is awesome though.

zjWTZQffMRpn5bWDgzaHcw.review_text: This review is based upon delivery and quality of pizza..  It was a late night and my favorite pizza place was closed (Deja Vu), so I wanted a quick delivery, so I decied to call Bruno's which was fairly close..  I ordered the Sonoma Chicken pizza (i believe thats the name) which had baby spinach leaves, grilled chicken breast, olives, bell peppers, garlic aioli.. The pizza, wasnt half-bad, I've had waayy better (at Deja Vu).  I believe it was the pizza sauce that I really didn't care for because you really cant go wrong with toppings, but the grilled chicken breast tasted favorless also.. The cheese however was thick and rich with flavor!  The delivery was fast, prompt, and friendly...

q_cYc9EJN1fzV7zwzc6MkA.review_text: I didn't eat any food, but stopped in for a quick drink. They have a great happy hour deal and a really good selection of beer. If you sit at the bar, they have the purse hooks I love so you can have your purse down by your knee. The bar is HUGE though, you can't tell just looking at it, but the seats are just a little low so you feel like a little kid.  The bartender was nice and there was good football on, so I didn't mind the little kid feeling behind the bar.

GrktSJ7Bv9t37gwDLIlAwg.review_text: 2.75$ pints all day !!! sweetness.  This is everything including the drink specials / beer cocktails. The beer selection is good I tell you. You can't go wrong serving Guinness, Dogfish Head, Stella, Fat Tire, Sam Adams, Old Rasputin, and cider. That's like an all star line up right there.  Our waitress was awesome. She was probably one of the best waitresses I've ever had. She would be over at our table in two seconds if we had made eye contact from across the room. That's good.  The pizzas were great too. It was thin and it did not get soggy. We shared a pizza with half of the bayou special on one side and bourbon street special on the other side. I liked both of them. The bayou special was not so salty like most pizzas with clam on it, which was nice. The cheese was not too thick and eating this pizza did not make me feel gross at all.  For three people, we got 4 beers and 1 large pizza. It came out to be about 12$ per person after tax and tip. That's pretty cheap for a nice sit down place like this I'd say. It does look a little on the pricey side, especially when you walk in, but it's definitely affordable and worth it.

x6_8-SBS55EU4xNIjS2rrA.review_text: im so on the fence between 3 and 4 stars.. the service is always great and the beer and wine and chamapagne is always good... pizza is decent but I had this one pasta dish that was just so awful... And the ambiance is always chill and good time esqe....k.. 4 stars it is... and it is a super good location.. close to me and validated parking for our friends... MY bf always comes here with his friends and they always love it.. I think it is more of a Pub with good food than a Pizzeria that serves beer.  I come here for drinks and it just so happends that they have edible pizza.. like its pretty dang good for being a bar.

hxLQTFMIeezdMnapAZ4Xrw.review_text: I ordered last night on my phone, using their website's online ordering. On the page, it said "Free delivery!" but after ordering, the receipt that popped up definitely said $3 delivery charge. That kind of false advertising irritated me so I called to ask and they said, "Oh, we started charging in January. We will have to change our website." No offer to eliminate the delivery charge.  We got the food and it all tasted store-bought. The meatballs looked and tasted like frozen meatballs you can buy at Costco. The marinara sauce seemed like it was out of a jar. Not worth it. Order elsewhere or just make something at home.

icXtXn49JRXM5w_hCbrt9w.review_text: So here's the deal.  Bruno's for lunch is great if you're in a hurry. They can knock out a caesar salad and pizza in 15 minutes.  So this would be perfect for a 20 minute lunch for $10.  Dinner on the other hand is solid, especially before a show at the Fillmore. First, order the toasted ravioli. It's yummsters. Then finish off with one of their  pizzas.  Get beer, their sodas are kind of expensive.  Bruno's is an upscale pizza joint, with nice specialty pizzas.

TLVW8-_by4bGXmqSMmr-AQ.review_text: The place was pretty intimate, had a real mellow vibe.  Nice chill bar with a cherry flat screen t.v. to catch sports. The jazz theme with the music and decorations were cool considering it was Italian food.  Especially enjoyed the Al Pacino, Robert De Niro "Heat" commemorative plaque they had posted.    The service was very hospitable and the owner even came up and introduced himself to everyone that was in the restaurant.  Old school moves like that always impress me.      I had a cup of soup, salad, and the Sonoma Chicken Pizza and every dish was good.  There prices are quite reasonable and well worth it for what I had there.    The place had been open for just over a couple weeks, so I definitely recommend checking it out.

ADIMCaJqpUy97l8LMOtHYA.review_text: Just ordered from Bruno's tonight for the first time (those pesky fliers DO work).  First off, good customer service. The girl who took my order didn't seem annoyed from the moment she answered the phone (as some other pizza places make you feel), repeated everything back to make sure the order was correct, etc. She quoted me 45 min for delivery. Maybe 30 min later received a call from the delivery guy confirming my cross streets and letting me know he'd be there in 5-7 minutes. MUCH appreciated since I have dogs that go crazy. I like to be able to meet the delivery guy at the main door to avoid chaos. Sure enough he was at the steps of my building in 5 minutes. Also very cheerful and pleasant!  Now to the food...I really do like the pizza! I ordered pepperoni, mushroom and garlic. The crust is on the thinner side, but wonderfully a little chewy. Generous with the toppings, especially the garlic. I love my garlic! I also ordered the garlic bread w/ marinara sauce. It was just ok. It's actually focaccia bread or some type of flat bread, not bad...but I guess I was expecting the traditional sourdough or something.  The  accompanying marinara sauce serving size was generous.  Great experience. Good pizza. Will definitely be ordering from here again.

OY32TwbyMP1z6MIyirm0Yw.review_text: This is another recent addtion to our Fillmore resturant row.  I believe that they are affiliated with 1600 on Fillmore, just across the street.  To be honest, I like the concept, the chef is very personable, but the food was just ok...they had some authentic italian servers, but I don't think they had a ton of experience.  They were rather unattentive, and kinda slow.  I want to support my local neighborhood resturants, so I'll maybe give them another try...but with Paxti's & Little Star nearby, it's tough...  Oh, they do have one awesome item on their menu that I haven't seen out here since I moved from Chicago - fried ravioli.....mmmmm, breaded/fried, crispy cheese pasta.

pKSVqOWpyVc3dwGogNhphg.review_text: This place was the most convenient restaurant for us to grab a bite to eat before a show at Yoshi's on a Saturday night. We tried to venture to Little Star a few blocks away and even Fillmore St Cafe (which did not have any seats, and we were not going to eat while standing) so we ended up here instead, but felt good about our fate.   The waitress, Quanie? was very sweet with her beautiful smile, watch out guys and gals, she is a cutie and a great server. She encouraged us to come in the restaurant and made recommendations for pizza. We ordered the Popeye's with spinach, pesto, feta and olives. Prices for the pizza were a little high, but the pizza was good to us.   Chicken sandwich was a good deal for under 9 bucks, with french fries. However, my only gripe was that they could have used a better roll for the sandwich (they used a cheap sesame burger bun).  The server also offered us free tastings of the spicy carrot soup, which was very savory. We even ordered some garlic bread with cheese (a little pricey at 4 bucks for two pieces), but the marinara was creamy and tomatoey which I liked a lot.   I wouldn't say this is a must go to place, but it is worth a stop if you happen to eat right before the show and are not in the mood for seafood at Yoshi's.

b1QHC8ddf96NpOCWWWTihg.review_text: This place sucks!  I'm only giving it 2 stars because the atmosphere had a cool vibe.  My friend and I came to Bruno's Pizzeria after a show at Yoshi's. (Across the street). It was on the late night , so it was only a few people inside.   We sat down at the bar and the bartender handed us our menus. We were excited to try some of the dishes they had to offer. I ordered the ravioli and my friend order a pizza. ( I forgot the exact name of the pizza ) We waited for 15 mins and our food was served.   First..... My friend couldn't believe her eyes. She thought she was getting punk. Her pizza didn't NOT look like the one in the menu.  So she tried it and spit it back out. She swore that they served her a DiGiorno frozen pizza.  SMH.  Second... I tried my ravioli and basically, I wasn't impressed. The ravioli stated that it came with spinach inside, so I assuming fresh spinach. I was mistaken. It was frozen spinach. I had a few bites and then I couldn't eat it anymore.  Third.. the bartender was nice and all but not once did she check on us to see how are food was and if we needed anything else. She was too busy texting all dam night.   By this time, its only two customers left at Bruno's Pizzeria, so you would think they would have brought back our check in a timely matter. NOT the case!  I was just fed up after we didn't get our change back after 30 minutes.   Please find another place in the Fillmore to eat because Bruno's Pizzeria is not the place!   Please learn from my experience.

xYf9oB8-coHeAkvvEdq79Q.review_text: Bruno's s a wonderful Fillmore neighborhood spot. Awesome pizza, lasagna, ravioli, wine and beers. The waitresses are nice and friendly, and nice to look at. giants baseball on big Hi-def, and...the owner is there each night overseeing things. All in all, a great place if you want a locals experience, and not many tourists. Close to the Fillmore, and across the street from Yoshi's. On my most recent business trip, I visited 3 times in one week. Excellent and fresh every time. The atmosphere is also very clean and cool, with a updated modern look, and a jazz theme.Very cool. I entertained colleagues there this last week, we arrived about 9, and they'd loved it too.

mg-HQR5V_geD22hhiHTo6g.review_text: Pretty good. But not the best. Just a tip, do not get the Bruno's special pizza, it's not good, however the margherita pizza is good. I also have ordered the combo platter on many occasions, it's ok but not as good as it used to be, they now serve the wings as a fried wing they used to be served as juicy marinated hot wings. The cheese sticks are now thicker and harder to chew. Idk if they were being lazy because I ordered at about 12am but this place is starting to drop the ball a little. Anyway some things are good here and a plus is that they are open late and deliver.

8p2sKVE5CE5d1Yuj_O9Zrw.review_text: The calzone is tasty.  Other than that, everything seems to be pretty average.  Everything except the bizarre southwestern egg rolls, or were they southeastern egg rolls.  Whatever they were, they were a tribute to just how bland something can be.  I suppose it is my own fault for ordering such an item at a pizzeria.  You live and you learn.  Anyway, if you are looking for some satisfactory Italian-American food, Bruno's can fill that void.

RxPT7CjNaTdBirCBVj87gQ.review_text: I basically live next to this place, and walk by it on the way to the bus stop. I'd check out the renovations each day, and wonder when it would open. After all, that block of Fillmore needs something better than Domino's.  My roommate and I went to check it out opening weekend. We admired the clarinets on the wall (former band nerds, what can you do) and started the buttery-squashy complimentary soup. Then the power went out. The manager hurriedly went out for candles, ultimately returning with a single 5" stub. The kitchen staff tried to cook using the light of their iPhones. After 20 minutes and steadfastly cold ovens, we gave up our dream of Sonoma Spinach Chicken Pizza and sobbed into our Mexican food up the street.  We tried again one week later, for girls' night out for Valentine's Day. I have one vegetarian friend who also avoids dairy, onion, and garlic; finding a suitable restaurant with a wide array of salads can be *challenging*. But Bruno's came through; she enjoyed her salad, while the rest of us split that Sonoma Spinach Chicken Pizza, saving some for our post-Mission-bar-crawl late night snack. Mmm, ricotta.  I can't comment on too much of the menu, having tried exactly (1) item. But I did enjoy that pizza! My friends and I thought that, given the ambiance and quality of the food, prices were surprisingly non-shafty. I think total came to $8.50 per person! I think appetizers, salads, and the calzones (as entrees) were all *well* under $10.   Bonus points for accommodating our request and switching to the Cal-Stanford women's basketball game on the big TV. I am totally subtracting a star because Cal ended up losing. Come on, Bruno's, you should have stopped the Bears from fizzling in the second half!  Basically, I dig the food and I dig the prices. Also, I like whimsy, and there are some playfully named dishes on the menu, showing some love to Bruno's neighbors in the Fillmore Center. That's cool. I wish somebody named a pizza after me. Well, maybe not, because that would mean I ate a lot of pizza, and that doesn't fit in too well with my New Year's resolution. Anyway, I will definitely come here again and wish Bruno's well.
